result.execSummary:
The defendant Jesse J. Hanson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jesse J. Hanson is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jesse J. Hanson was found guilty of OWI (4th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

- Sign up for Probation

A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
- or Rule/25 and follow through with recommendations

sentencing checklist. arc
For CCAP purposes only. kma

11:29 AM  CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Christianson. Prosecuting attorney Brian Thomas Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Jesse J. Hanson. Defendant Jesse J. Hanson in court. Includes 20CT137, 20TR3838, 22CF593. Court reviews case. 22CF593: Court finds Def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause and binds Def over for trial. Atty Smestad recites resolution. Court questions Defendant. Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands and pleads No Contest to Count 1: OWI 4th- 346.63(1)(a) in case 22CF593. Court finds that Defendant has freely and voluntarily entered plea and waived rights. Court accepts plea and finds sufficient facts. Court finds Defendant guilty. Upon motion of the State, Court dismisses 22CF593 Count 2, 20CT137, and 20TR3838. Sentencing arguments. 

Court Orders:
22CF593 Count 1: OWI 4th. W/S 2 Years probation

- 360 days condition time. 180 days Stayed. to commence today. Huber eligible for Employment and Treatment. 
- Fine: $600.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- Court Costs: $268.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation
- DNA Surcharge: $250.00. Apply Bond. Balance to be pd through probation

Conditions of Probation:

- DNA Sample
- AODA/ Rule 25 and follow through with recommendations
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Not to enter any business or establishment where the primary purpose is sale of alcohol
- Not to possess a firearm
- Lifetime drivers license revocation- credit for administrative suspension
- IID
- Eligible to apply for treatment court in the event of ATR
- Participate in Restorative Justice program if Agent requests
- Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid license
- Subject to random UA's and PBT's
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent
- Pay supervision fees
- Sign up for probation

10:06 AM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Fox, Defendant Jesse J. Hanson appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Bela Alexander Ballo in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Jesse J. Hanson. Includes 22CF593, 20CT137 and 20TR3838. Atty Ballo moves to dismiss 20CT137. Another OWI is open in Pierce County set for on October 4, 2022. Atty Satorius requests a plea before October 4th. Court does not dismiss 20CT137 at today's hearing. INIT, waiver of PH and Plea for case 22CF593 at next hearing. Bond continues.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 27, 2022 at 03:00 pm. Includes 22CF593, 20CT137 and 20TR3838

3:52 PM CO: Vlack, Reporter: Gross, Clerk: Lindabaur. Defendant Jesse J. Hanson appeared by video.  Attorney Travis Satorius in court for Jesse J. Hanson.  Prosecuting attorney Aaron M. Damrau for ADA Brian Smestad in court for the State of Wisconsin. Includes 20CT137 PLEAS, 20TR3838 PLEAS, and 22CF593 INIT. ADA Damrau states 22CF593 has been filed as an OWI 4th, as DE has plead to an OWI 3rd. Court reviews complaint in 22CF593. Court suggests stayed warrant. Atty Satorius responds. Court will listen back to last hearing. Court amends bond in 20CT137. Clerk to mail complaint in 22CF593 and bond in 20CT137 to DE at treatment facility. Court adjourns INIT in 22CF593. Court sets further hearing and will allow DE to appear by Zoom. Adjourned at 4:07 PM.  gll
